input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.

XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.

XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.

XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.

XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipfwadm -A -I</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipfwadm -A -I</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipfwadm -A -I</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipfwadm -A -I</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="WindowsDefault"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipfwadm -O -I</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipfwadm -O -I</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipfwadm -F -I</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipfwadm -F -I</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipfwadm -M -I</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipfwadm -M -I</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
ipfwadm - IP firewall and accounting administration. This process displays the currently installed rules.
Note: ipfwadm must be installed for this process to work.
